name: Home-ing Missiles
description:
On a planet inexplicably devoid of housing, two rival real estate agencies stand at the ready to supply homeless dudes with new homes. With their respective missile silos, they will now launch and steer Home-ing Missiles directly to spawn houses around dudes.

Even though they are homeless, dudes are picky and will refuse to live in any house of unmatching color. When placed in a house of a matching color however, they will award points.

Missiles have limited fuel before they tumble down into the planet uncontrollably. Fuel is depleted slowly over time when flying. There is also a boost however that will deplete fuel fast. Controllable with keyboard/joystick/controller/mouse.

Made during Global Game Jam 2019, on the LiU Game Jam site, based on the theme What home means to you.

Controls Keyboard

Force-quit game | Alt + F4 [NOTE: Not in the browser version!]

Player 1

Launch/Boost | Space
Look around/Steer | W, A, S, D

Player 2

Launch/Boost | Enter
Look around/Steer | Arrow keys

Mouse (Player 2)

Launch/Boost | Left mouse click
Look around/Steer | Mouse movement

Xbox 360 controller

Launch/Boost | A
Look around/Steer | Left thumb stick

Joystick

Launch/Boost | Button 1
Look around/Steer | Joystick tilting

Credits Axel Nordanskogprogramming, 3D modellingErik Mansénprogramming, UI, planet look-aroundFrans Skarmanprogramming, missile physics, rocket trailsJoakim Nilssonprogramming, environmental visuals
